meanings.definition: Having skin that is burned by the sun.
meanings.sent1: After a long day at the beach, my face was sunburnt and painful.
meanings.sent2: She applied sunscreen to avoid getting sunburnt during her vacation.
meanings.sent3: Despite his best efforts, he ended up with a sunburnt nose that made him look like a lobster.
meanings.sent4: The sunburnt landscape stretched out before us, a reminder of the scorching heat.
meanings.sent5: The sunburnt cheeks of the children showed they had spent the entire day playing outside.

meanings.definition: To burn the skin by exposure to the sun.
meanings.sent1: If you stay out too long, you will sunburnt your skin and regret it later.
meanings.sent2: Remember to wear a hat to avoid getting sunburnt on your face.
meanings.sent3: She managed to sunburnt her shoulders even though she applied sunscreen multiple times.
meanings.sent4: The intense sun seemed determined to sunburnt anyone who dared to stay outside for too long.
meanings.sent5: The sunburnt tourists were a clear sign that they had underestimated the strength of the sun.
